whatSosUaDoesSection.title: What does SOS-UA do?

bulletPoints.0: Volunteers and institutions describe accommodation offered (type, maximum capacity, length of stay)
bulletPoints.1: People looking for a shelter define their needs and minimum requirements (e.g. group size, location)
bulletPoints.2: UA-SOS automatically connects those in need of shelter with the best-suited accommodation offered by hosts

whatSosUaDoesSection.algorithmExplanation: The algorithm optimizes matches, so that as many people in need find shelter
whatSosUaDoesSection.description: The portal connects people in need with institutions and people offering their help

0.title: Registration
0.text: The user registers on the portal as either offering accommodation or needing shelter

1.title: Filling the form
1.text: The user fills in a form on the offered accommodation or the accommodation sought.

2.title: Automatic matching
2.text: The algorithm searches the database of offered accommodation and people in need and, based on the information provided, selects the best match

3.title: Information sent to the user
3.text: After the correct match, users receive an email. An additional description of connected users is available in the application.

4.title: Users contact each other
4.text: After the connection is made, it is possible to contact each other by e-mail or telephone in order to discuss the details

5.title: Confirmation or rejection of the offer
5.text: The last step is to confirm or decline the offer in the app. If the offer is rejected, it is returned to the pool
